means: 废除（法律等）( abrogate的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The president abrogated an old law.
sentence.Network_cn: 总统废除了一项旧法令.

sentence.Network_en: Fiji's president abrogated the constitutionand reappointed Mr Bainimarama as prime minister.
sentence.Network_cn: 斐济总统废除了宪法,重新任命拜尼玛拉马(Bainimarama)作为国家总理.

list.abs: a government may abrogate any unfair treaties ., 政府可以取消任何不公平的条约.
The government can not cannot just abrogate contracts ., 国家不能只是废除合同.
单词【abrogate】的释义、短语及例句 ... 2:abrogate agreement 取消协议; 3:Abrogate Treaty 废除条约.
In the meeting , he abolished or abrogated some laws ., 会议中 , 他废止或废除了一些法律.

entry.tran: 废除，取消（法令、协议、习俗等）
entry.def: If someone in a position of authority abrogates something such as a law, agreement, or practice, they put an end to it.

example.ex: The next prime minister could abrogate the treaty.
example.tran: 下一任首相可能会废除这个条约。

auth_sentence.content: The government had abrogated its authority, and it had no right to make any demands.
auth_sentence.res_content: The government had abrogated its authority, and it had no right to make any demands.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The government had abrogated its authority, and it had no right to make any demands.
